meanings.definition: A performance of music or dance.
meanings.sent1: The school held a recital showcasing the students' musical talents.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed the piano recital at the community center.
meanings.sent3: During the recital, the cat unexpectedly joined in by meowing along.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful movements in the dance recital were like a painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The recital was so enchanting that it felt like being transported to a magical world.

meanings.definition: The act of reciting from memory or reading aloud.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her recital of the poem until she knew it by heart.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to take turns in the recital of the passage.
meanings.sent3: During the recital, he accidentally skipped a line and had to start over.
meanings.sent4: Her recital of the story was so vivid, it felt like watching a movie.
meanings.sent5: The recital of the speech was so powerful that it left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: An enumeration or listing of items.
meanings.sent1: The recital of the groceries she needed to buy was written on a piece of paper.
meanings.sent2: He made a recital of all the reasons why he deserved a promotion.
meanings.sent3: In the recital of his favorite movies, he forgot to mention the classic he loved.
meanings.sent4: The recital of the rules was like a roadmap to success for the team.
meanings.sent5: Her recital of the ingredients for the recipe was clear and easy to follow.
